results.title: My Urban Garden
results.brief_description: A practical guide with some “helpful hints” on how to plan your own urban vegetable garden. This will appeal to all gardening enthusiasts and possibly even inspire those who have never tried.

results.title: My university challenge
results.creator_credit: Ray Martin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ray Martin and his girlfriend enrolled in a university course in Thailand to become qualified English teachers. It was here that Martin set himself a challenge that not many people had been successful at achieving.

results.title: My uncle = Mon oncle [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Louis Dolivet, Alterdel-Centaure, Fray and Specta
results.brief_description: Mon Oncle is a poetic satire depicting man against machine, rather in the manner of Chaplin’s “Modern Times” and Rene Clair’s “A Nous la Liberte”. Hulot is little Gerard Arpel’s uncle, a fond relative whose whimsical ways fail to impress the boy’s ultra-modern parents. What transpires is a masterpiece of design which develops Tati’s unique comic vision without ever losing sight of the essential simplicity he holds so dear. Deft, elusive, full of heart, “Mon Oncle” is a film to see again and again. Winner of Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. Also available on VHS [301867].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Tati, Louis Dolivet, Alterdel-Centaure, Fray and Specta

results.title: My turtle died today
results.brief_description: In this first-person story, a boy recalls the death of a pet. His father, his teacher, and the pet-shop owner are unable to help his sick turtle, and it dies. This story creates an opportunity for discussion of the inevitability of death and the continuity of life. Adapted from the Little Owl book.

results.title: My truth
results.creator_credit: Vladimir Keca, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vladimir Keca lived a sheltered life in a remote part of the former Yugoslavia with his grandparents. But once war broke out, he was removed from his comfort zone and, while it changed everything, Keca is not so sure that it was all bad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vladimir Keca, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My tree
results.creator_credit: Kamsani Bin Salleh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Families are always moving forward and tend to rarely dwell on the past. However, its important for Kamsani Bin Salleh to find out about his family history, for a greater sense of who he is, if nothing else. As he trawls his family history, he discovers the vast array of cultures that have contributed to his existence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kamsani Bin Salleh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
